thread.title: Facebook log on glitch leads to amazing love story for Schuler Benson and Celeste Zendler | DailyTelegraph
thread.title_full: Facebook log on glitch leads to amazing love story for Schuler Benson and Celeste Zendler | DailyTelegraph

author: Ian Horswill
title: Facebook log on glitch leads to amazing love story for Schuler Benson and Celeste Zendler | DailyTelegraph
text:
THE odds are staggering but a Facebook user who logged onto a female stranger’s account due to a simple glitch has found love and the pair have married.
Six years ago on October 4, Schuler Benson switched his mobile phone on to find it was logged in to a female stranger’s Facebook account.
The woman, Celeste Zendler , had no mutual friends and Schuler, a writer, had never seen or even heard of her before. She lived in Colorado, which is over 1,600 kilometres away from his home in Arkansas.
Schuler Benson accidentally logged into a stranger's Facebook account and sparked a love affair that has turned into marriage. Picture: Facebook
Despite not knowing each other and living 1600 kilometres apart, Schuler Benson and Celeste Zendler gradually fell in love. Picture: Facebook
Schuler logs into Celeste's account for a second time and proposes to her. Picture: Facebook
Married six years after meeting through a technical glitch on an account on Facebook. Picture: Scott Uhl Photography / Celeste Zendler / Facebook
The odds of Schuler and Celeste meeting, let alone falling in love, were less than 1 in 175 million. Picture: Scott Uhl Photography / Celeste Zendler / Facebook
1 of n
